other_materials: Compacted Granular Fill 'A', Foam Construction Gasket, Fibre Mesh
key_elements: Concrete Piers, Foam Construction Gasket, Slab-on-Grade
overall_building_description: The foundation system for the project at 425 North Road, Gabriola, BC, is meticulously designed to ensure structural integrity and durability. The slab-on-grade foundation is constructed with 5 1/2 inches of 32 MPa poured concrete, which is reinforced using either 6x6x6/6 welded wire mesh (WWM), a 16" x 16" 10M rebar grid, or fibre mesh. This reinforcement strategy ensures adequate tensile strength and crack control within the slab. The slab rests on a minimum of 6 inches of compacted granular fill 'A', providing a stable and uniform base that distributes loads effectively to the underlying bedrock. The use of compacted granular fill is critical for achieving the necessary bearing capacity and minimizing settlement. The slab is further supported by concrete piers, each measuring 16" x 16", which are pinned to the bedrock using (4) 12-inch long 15M rebar dowels. These dowels are embedded a minimum of 6 inches into the bedrock, ensuring a secure connection that resists lateral and vertical loads. The joint between the concrete piers and the bedrock is grouted with waterproof hydraulic cement, providing a continuous seal that prevents water ingress and enhances the durability of the foundation system. The bedrock surface is meticulously prepared by cleaning and roughening, followed by the application of a bonding agent to ensure optimal adhesion of the concrete. A foam construction gasket is strategically placed between new and existing concrete elements to accommodate differential movement and prevent cracking. This gasket is also used around each sonotube to isolate the new slab from existing structures, thereby enhancing the overall flexibility and performance of the foundation. The slab-on-grade construction includes a slope grade away of 2%, which is essential for effective drainage and preventing water accumulation around the foundation. The detailed section views, such as those labeled 1/S1, 2/S1, and 3/S1, provide comprehensive insights into the construction methodology, highlighting the integration of structural components and the meticulous attention to detail in the design. The use of 15M continuous rebar throughout the slab and piers ensures a robust reinforcement framework capable of withstanding various load conditions. The foundation design adheres to stringent engineering standards, incorporating advanced materials and construction techniques to achieve a high-performance structural system. The project specifications emphasize the importance of precise construction practices, including the use of bonding agents, grout, and foam gaskets, to achieve a seamless integration of new and existing structural elements. The foundation system is engineered to provide long-term stability and resilience, accommodating both static and dynamic loads while maintaining structural integrity under varying environmental conditions. The comprehensive design approach ensures that the foundation will perform effectively throughout its service life, providing a reliable base for the superstructure above.
